import React, { Component } from 'react'; import '../App.css'; import { Card, CardDeck } from 'react-bootstrap'; import{ BrowserRouter, Link } from 'react-router-dom'; const CairnCare = () => { return (
Cairn Maintenance

Hair cutting

I have gone into a professional groomer and had their haircut at home, especially make sure to make appointments with your groomer way before the holidays, as some book out for months around the holiday season. I have found that a hair cutting technic referred to as hand stripping allows the cairn to retain their wire hair-like texture and in doing so gives them a waterproof type layer of fur. Every cairn is a little different when it comes to getting a hair buzzed hair cut. I had my sire hair buzzer haircut when he was younger in age and his hair was very soft, but it is not as good at keeping him warm or waterproof. I never got my sire hair cut with hand strippers. His hair now, after well over a year has become more wire type hair in some spots, despite only cutting with hair buzzers. My dams are all hand stripped, but I had one hair buzz one, one time when she was younger. It stunted her hair growth. That's the last time she got hair buzzed.

Nail Trimming

This is something I recommend for a groomer as well, but you will know your getting closer to the time to get nails cut when it has been a while and you can hear their nails tap on the floor. Cairns have nails that are black so you cant see

Shedding

I have found when the season changes from winter to summer that Cairns will shed quite a bit. Brushing their coat during the seasons changing can significantly reduce shedding, normally around once a week, hair brushing well help a lot, if not completly.
); } export default CairnCare;
